result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per order of Judge Dorow - the order to produce is cancelled, and the defendant is to appear by video from Dodge Correctional Institution.
Detainer acknowledged from DCI

Letter from Attorney Wolff requesting that the defendant remain at Dodge Correctional for the next hearing.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/31/2022 - The Court has no objection to Mr. Krimmer appearing by video as long as he is willing to waive his right to be present at the start of the hearing on 11/7. The order to produce shall promptly be cancelled.**
Detainer placed at: Dodge Correctional Institution.

Notice of Motion and Motion to File Amended Information, filed by the State.
**Reviewed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 9/28/22 - The Court will address the motion on 11/7/22.**
Letter from ADA Zilavy to the Court requesting a motion hearing date to address the filing of an amended information.
Laboratory report filed by the State.

Letter from Attorney Wolff requesting that the defendant remain in the Waukesha County Jail until his upcoming plea/sentencing hearing.
**Request was previously denied by Judge Dorow on 9/16/2022.**

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 9/15/2022 from the defendant requesting that he stay at the Waukesha County Jail until his next court appearance.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/16/2022 - The Court does not generally interfere with the movement of inmates and sees no reason why to do so in this case. As such the request is denied.**

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

02:37 PM Defendant Claytin E Krimmer in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Attorney Menden requests the Court set this for a preliminary hearing within 20 days and they will ensure to evaluate the defendant and are confident he will qualify.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Court further sets a status of counsel date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
